```{r echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)

colors<-c(
  "#008b99", #1 blue green
  "#ee8670", #2 pink
  "#004fa1", #3 blue
  "#ffa700", #4 orange
  "#8d9385" #5 grey
)

g<-ggplot()+ theme(panel.background = element_rect(fill=colors[5], colour='white'),
                   panel.grid.major = element_blank(),
                   panel.grid.minor = element_blank())

# making one shape




g<-g+geom_polygon(
  aes(
    x=c(0, 1,1,.3, 0),
    y=c(0, 0, 1, .7, 0)),
  fill=colors[1]
)




one.shape<-data.frame(
  x.seq<-rep(seq(0,6, length=4), 4),
  y.seq<-c(rep(0,4), rep(2,4), rep(4,4), rep(6,4)),
  random.colors<-sample(colors[1:4], size=16, replace=TRUE)
  )%>%
  purrr::pmap(., 
            ~geom_polygon(
              aes(
                x=c(0, 0, 1, .7, 0)+..1,
                y=c(0, -1, -1, -.3,0)+..2,
               ),
              fill=..3)
            )


two.shape<-data.frame(
  x.seq<-rep(seq(0,6, length=4), 4),
  y.seq<-c(rep(0,4), rep(2,4), rep(4,4), rep(6,4)),
  random.colors<-sample(colors[1:4], size=16, replace=TRUE)
  )%>%
  purrr::pmap(., 
            ~geom_polygon(
              aes(
                x=c(0, -1,-1,-.3, 0)+..1,
                y=c(0, 0, -1, -.7,0)+..2,
               ),
              fill=..3)
            )

three.shape<-data.frame(
  x.seq<-rep(seq(0,6, length=4), 4),
  y.seq<-c(rep(0,4), rep(2,4), rep(4,4), rep(6,4)),
  random.colors<-sample(colors[1:4], size=16, replace=TRUE)
  )%>%
  purrr::pmap(., 
            ~geom_polygon(
              aes(
                x=c(0, 0,-1, -.7, 0)+..1,
                y=c(0, 1, 1, .3, 0)+..2,
               ),
              fill=..3)
            )

four.shape<-data.frame(
  x.seq<-rep(seq(0,6, length=4), 4),
  y.seq<-c(rep(0,4), rep(2,4), rep(4,4), rep(6,4)),
  random.colors<-sample(colors[1:4], size=16, replace=TRUE)
  )%>%
  purrr::pmap(., 
            ~geom_polygon(
              aes(
                x=c(0, 1,1,.3, 0)+..1,
                y=c(0, 0, 1, .7, 0)+..2,
               ),
              fill=..3)
            )
g<-g+one.shape+two.shape+three.shape+four.shape

#finishing out the image 
g<-g+  coord_fixed()+
  scale_x_continuous(limits = c(-1,7), expand = c(0, 0)) +
  scale_y_continuous(limits = c(-1,7), expand = c(0, 0))+
  theme(axis.title.x=element_blank(),
        axis.text.x=element_blank(),
        axis.ticks.x=element_blank(),
        axis.title.y=element_blank(),
        axis.text.y=element_blank(),
        axis.ticks.y=element_blank())

png("ODO.png", height=1200, width=1200)
g
dev.off()

g

```
